data.title: Great breakfast place!
data.text: Friendly staff. Clean. Good prices. Our waitress, Patricia, was helpful and offered good suggestions. We had skillets and stuffed the leftover potatoes into a tortilla, which we later enjoyed during our long wait at the tramway.  The coffee pot was left at our table, along with a plentiful supply of cream.  Decor was fresh and aesthetically pleasing.  Clean restrooms.

data.title: Vacation
data.text: The Village Inn is a nice friendly restaurant that have the friendliest staff!! The restaurant are very clean and the bathrooms were nice and clean!! The breakfast was fresh and very good, the problem was they had so much on the menus that it was had to choice!!! The prices were not bad either!! The Village Inn was well worth the stop!!

data.title: Typical Chain family Resturant
data.text: I used to go with my husband and kids, The pies are yummy, decently priced, generally very busy on the weekends for breakfast! Friendly staff, family friendly, sometimes it can be very difficult to have a bit of conversation, loud atmosphere!!☺

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: Our waitress visited our table twice. Once to take the order and the second to drop off our food and ticket. She never asked if we wanted dessert or to see if we needed refills. The food wasn't bad

data.title: Consistent Food, Friendly Service
data.text: We re-visited this place recently and found it consistent with our earlier visit. Food is tasty and competently prepared, service is friendly and accommodating, and we got good value for our dollar.

data.title: Very awesome male waiter
data.text: This place had the best male waiter I have ever seen. He made sure we got what we wanted for the best price. He made sure we were happy with our food and kept our drinks full. The food here was very good.

data.title: Restaurant has later hours than many in the area. Good for pie and coffee, but the food is very average.reasonable price
data.text: average food, terrible service. the pies are ok. we had the chicken pot pie and that was good, but the server always disappears after the order is delivered and never comes back to check on the table. this has been the case 2x that we have eaten there. service needs to be improved.

data.title: Free Pie Wednesday
data.text: The food here is always very good, as is the service.  When you come on Wednesdays, the waitstaff reminds you that is is free pie day.  The pieces of pie are the usual generous size, too

data.title: Free Pie
data.text: Village inn is my favorite restaurant. Why? Because they have milkshakes! I know it sounds lame but I go for my  birthday and treat myself to my favorite entree and a milkshake! The service has always been great and they have free pie every Wednesday!

data.title: Only what can be expected from a franchise.
data.text:
When we arrived we thought we would have a long wait because the parking lot was so full.  We were pleasantly surprised for a group of six.  Over all that was the exception as the wait for food after order was very excessively long. Combining that with ordering iced tea and getting hot; asking repeatedly for sugar; getting eggs fixed medium when ordering sunny side up; the place was obviously under staffed.

In our waitresses defense, she was friendly and did everything she could go try and keep us satisfied.  She was obviously over worked; if fact, the wait staff that was there were all racing to keep up.

The best part was the French Toast - golden brown, ever so slightly crunchy on the outside, thick sliced, and tasty.  By itself - excellent.

data.title: relatives
data.text: slow, poor service.  the pancakes were not good.  how do u mess up pancakes?  the coffee was weak.  the omelets are really big.

data.title: A Good Breakfast anytime! And talk about a good Pie!!
data.text: The Village Inn is a very popular place here in Rio Rancho. It seems to always be busy but you rarely have to wait in line. They can accommodate a lot of people at once. It is always a great place to have breakfast or lunch. It is affordable and family friendly. Graphics yourself a piece or a whole pie on your way out!

data.title: Freezing cold and wait forever
data.text: Food was okay, it wasn't the best.  I kind of had higher expectation, but it has failed me twice.  I took a friend there for pie and coffee, and we waited for good 30 minutes before we got a menu, thank goodness we both had our cells.. once we finished chatting we could stare at our phones and share photos..  finally our yummies were served, but the good times froze by then..

data.title: Always good food
data.text: Every food item tried has been very good - the French Dip is best anywhere.  Salads are fresh and interesting.  The menu changes frequently but the "VIB" (Village Inn Breakfast is always there with a choice of four different items.  Service is good and staff is friendly.

data.title: All American resturant
data.text: Dine in or take out your traditional American style eats. New season selections have my attention that make me drool.  Slow service during rush hours but hot food every time.

data.title: The Substitute
data.text: If you have no better place to go then the Village Inn is OK.  The food ranges from good to plastic.  The kitchen staff has no idea how some dishes should be prepared; however, their efforts are above average.  The Wait Staff is most affable and most are competent.  The interior is clean and so are the rest facilities.  A chain restaurant with their food and quality being an average of all their locations.  Your choice.

data.title: Not the best restaurant in the area
data.text: My wife and I went to this restaurant on a Wednesday (Pie Night) and were disappointed to find that they were out of most of the pies. We ordered, and our food came out bland, full of grease, flavorless and in general, it was a disappointing evening. Maybe next wime.

data.title: Broccoli, coffee water, and percussion fries
data.text:
The only reason I am bothering to write this is to warn future customers. Things have to be bad for me to say anything at a dining place. And they were. When the server told us they were backed up in the kitchen. That was  really code for THINGS ARE REALLY BAD TONIGHT JUST LEAVE. But sadly we were too hungry to listen to instinct. The hot water that we ordered was served in a coffee pot and no one even tried to rinse it out first. It looked to be about 1 part coffee and 3 parts water.  We should have read that as the second bad sign and split. But we didn't. Now for the part you all have been waiting for....drum roll......the food arrives!! Yay! We were so excited and happy! The server was happy too and she left immediately after before I could even get the words out of my mouth that we need ketchup for the fries. Okay, no big deal lets dig in. And I attempted to slice my chicken fried steak. Hmmm, that's funny I don't remember it being that hard to cut before. I will munch on a piece of broccoli while I am cutting this steak is what I thought. As I was chewing the first piece of broccoli and still cutting my steak, my eyes caught something on the other broccoli. It appeared as though the stalks were used as fat oil dipsticks when the oil has not been changed in a year. Or maybe tar. But only if had been that maybe it would not have been as much of a problem. I knew what the black stuff was. I had seen it with my own broccoli after it has been forgotten and abandoned in some forsaken corner of the frig. It is a fungus. So I asked the nice lady who was serving us what she thought it was. She immediately offered to have them "cut it off" for me. I said, "no thanks". She asked if I wanted corn or something and I politely declined and asked if she could just take it off the bill. A few minutes later she came back and described to me that they just forget to cut the ends off and they need to look through them better next time. The set off alarms in my head as I was still working on extracting some protein from the chicken fried steak. Still no ketchup which would not have helped anyway because by that time I had figured out how to use the solid fries as percussion instruments. These particular fries were not useful as food because it probably would have taken my system more calories to convert these fries to energy than what it was worth. 
And they gave us a 10% "senior" (thanks guys) discount of about 3 bucks.

data.title: Service was better than the food.
data.text: Maria was a wonderful server, very personable and checked in frequently.  The turkey meal did not have the dressing and the broccoli had black spots on it.  My huevos rancheros was all mixed together and served on a tortilla; not a good presentation.  The highlight of the visit was that there were WWII vets in the restaurant who were probably in their 90s; an honor to dine nearby.

data.title: Chain resturant
data.text: Religion in Rio Rancho is chain restaurant it's decent food is very good a little overpriced I think but you get a good a good deal for your money okay fairly large portions if you feel like a large meal staff is a little slow no K and sometimes even when you're not busy it takes quite a while to get a second cup of coffee or a refill on water
